text.p: Wall Street stocks were expected on Tuesday to duplicate Monday's performance when the Dow Jones index overcame mild selling pressure to top 6,000 points during trading but failed to close above the milestone.
"I'm looking for the same trading pattern as yesterday, a little lower at the open and then a reversal," said Peter Cardillo, director of research at Westfalia Investments.
On Monday, despite clearing 6,000 twice, the Dow eventually ran out of steam and closed lower as investors took profits from stocks' recent sharp rally.
In contrast, the Nasdaq Composite achieved its first record close since the massive sell-off in July.
